quiz: prelab slm 22a welcome to the quiz for slm 22a! click below to get started. begin begin begin review exercise 22a review exercise 22a review exercise 22a review exercise 22a review exercise 22a

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the false pelvis contributes to the abdominal wall. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the true and false pelvis the pelvis is shaped like a fancy cocktail glass. it has a larger, upper bowl (a) and a smaller lower bowl (b). the false pelvis is the larger, upper bowl. it borders the lower abdominal wall and contains abdominal organs. the smaller, lower bowl is the true pelvis. it contains pelvic organs. the plane that separates the false and true pelvis is the pelvic inlet. the bony features that contribute to the pelvic inlet are labeled in this illustration. in anatomical position, as in this figure, the asis and the pubic tubercles are in the same vertical plane. therefore, the pelvic inlet is tipped very much forward and the body of the pubis is facing inferiorly, rather than anteriorly. 3 1. space a is the ____________ _____________. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the pelvic inlet separates the false pelvis from the true pelvis. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the true and false pelvis the pelvis is shaped like a fancy cocktail glass. it has a larger, upper bowl (a) and a smaller lower bowl (b). the false pelvis is the larger, upper bowl. it borders the lower abdominal wall and contains abdominal organs. the smaller, lower bowl is the true pelvis. it contains pelvic organs. the plane that separates the false and true pelvis is the pelvic inlet. the bony features that contribute to the pelvic inlet are labeled in this illustration. in anatomical position, as in this figure, the asis and the pubic tubercles are in the same vertical plane. therefore, the pelvic inlet is tipped very much forward and the body of the pubis is facing inferiorly, rather than anteriorly. 3 2. the plane enclosed by a is the ____________ _____________. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! remember, the ischiopubic rami, conjoint rami and pubic arches all refer to the same structures. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the pelvic outlet the sacrotuberous ligaments also contribute to the margin of the pelvic outlet, along with the ischiopubic (conjoint) rami, the pubic symphysis and the coccyx. most of the pelvic outlet is enclosed by the pelvic diaphragm, a funnel-shaped sheet of skeletal muscle that separates the true pelvis from the perineum. the perineum is defined as the region between the thighs, below the pelvic diaphragm. the relationship between the pelvic diaphragm and the pelvic wall is illustrated on the next slide. 6 3. the ________ _________ form the anterolateral borders of the pelvic outlet. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the sacrospinous ligament separates the greater and lesser sciatic foramen. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a ligaments the articulations between the bones of the pelvis are reinforced by numerous, strong ligaments. the sacrotuberous ligament and the sacrospinous ligament close off the greater and lesser sciatic notches, forming the greater and lesser sciatic foramina . the obturator membrane closes off the obturator foramen almost entirely, leaving a small opening, the obturator canal. recall that the obturator nerve, artery and vein pass through the obturator canal into the medial thigh. foramina (pl), foramen (s) opening; usually through a bony or ligamentous structure 4 4. identify ligament a. 2.2 quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the obturator internis arises from the obturator membrane and clothes the lateral wall of the pelvis and perineum. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the pelvic wall is clothed with muscles foramina (pl), foramen (s) opening; usually through a bony or ligamentous structure 5 the wall of the pelvis is clothed with two lateral rotators of the hip that originate within the pelvis, then exit to cross the back of the hip joint to the region of the greater trochanter. the piriformis originates on the anterior surface of the sacrum and exits the pelvis via the greater sciatic foramen. recall that the piriformis is the key to the region, and that the nerves and vessels that exit the pelvis through the greater sciatic foramen are land-marked according to their position relative to this muscle. the piriformis clothes the posterior wall of the pelvis. recall that the obturator membrane almost completely closes over the obturator foramen and that it serves to provide surface area for muscular attachment. originating on its internal surface is the obturator internis muscle. it passes out the lesser sciatic foramen, and clothes the lateral wall of the pelvis. 5. identify muscle a. 2.2 quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! this is the sagittal inlet. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a pelvic measurements in obstetrics a womans ability to safely deliver vaginally is predicted by the size of her pelvic inlet and outlet. the size of the pelvic inlet is determined using measurements of the: maximum transverse diameter of the inlet (a) sagittal inlet (b), measured between the sacral promontory and the top of the pubic symphysis. 10 the size of the pelvic outlet is determined using measurements of the: bispinous outlet (c), the distance between the ischial spines, which is the narrowest lateral dimension of the birth canal sagittal outlet (d), the distance between the coccyx and the bottom of the pubic symphysis 6. the measurement of the distance between the sacral promontory and top of the pubis symphysis is called the __________ ____________. 2.2 quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the transtubercular line bisect the perineum into the urogenital and anal triangles. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a borders, landmarks and triangles 13 the landmarks that define the pelvic outlet and perineum are the inferior border of the pubic symphysis, the tip of the coccyx and the left and right ischial tuberosities. the conjoint rami are formed by the fused inferior pubic ramus and ischial ramus. the pubic arch is formed by the left and right conjoint rami and defines the anterolateral borders of the perineum. the sacrotuberous ligaments, bilaterally, form the posterolateral borders of the perineum. for the purposes of description, the perineum is divided into the urogenital (ug) and anal triangles by the transtubercular line, an imaginary line that passes through the ischial tuberosities . the ug triangle is defined by this imaginary line, posteriorly, and the pubic arch anterolaterally. the anal triangle is defined by this imaginary line anteriorly and the sacrotuberous ligaments, posterolaterally. the two triangles are not in the same plane . the ug triangle is in a horizontal plane, while the anal triangle faces almost posteriorly. the angle of flexion between the two triangles is the imaginary transtubercular line. 7. the urogenital and anal triangles are separated by the ______________ line. 2.2 quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the pelvic diaphragm is the roof of the perineum and the floor of the pelvis. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the pelvic diaphragm 14 recall that the ug triangle contains the terminus of the urogenital tract and the anal triangle contains the terminus of the digestive tract. the transtubercular line separates the openings in the pelvic diaphragm that accommodate their passage. the pelvic diaphragm, separates the pelvis, above, from the perineum below. therefore, the pelvic diaphragm is the roof of the perineum. the pelvic diaphragm consists largely of the levator ani, although another muscle, the coccygeus, completes the pelvic diaphragm posteriorly. the fibres of the levator ani loop around the termini of the urogenital and digestive tracts, leaving a gap called the urogenital hiatus. the urethra (and vagina) pass through the urogenital hiatus. the levator ani assists the function of the external anal sphincter in maintaining fecal continence. 8. the muscular roof of the perineum is the _____________ _____________. 2.2 quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the deep perineal pouch is farther from the skin surface than the superficial perineal pouch. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the perineal membrane and deep perineal pouch 15 the perineal membrane extends between the conjoint rami within the ug triangle. it is a sheet of tough, dense, inextensible ct. its free posterior border extends between the ischial tuberosities. superior to the perineal membrane is the deep perineal pouch . it largely consists of skeletal muscle and neurovascular bundles. the superficial perineal pouch is inferior to the perineal membrane. *sigh* if ever a term was intended to confuse students, this is it. it is nothing like a pouch. its just a layer on the superior surface of the perineal membrane that includes skeletal muscles, nerves and blood vessels. the perineal membrane and deep perineal pouch close over the urogenital hiatus of the pelvic diaphragm, thereby completing the pelvic floor. in both sexes, an opening permits the passage of the urethra. in females, a second opening permits the passage of the vagina. in both sexes, the skeletal muscle of the deep perineal pouch includes the external urethral sphincter which provides voluntary control over micturition. external genitalia are tightly attached to the inferior surface of the perineal membrane and to the bony pubic arch. a hiatus between the anterior border of the perineal membrane and the pubic symphysis (blue arrow) permits the passage of neurovascular bundles from the deep perineal pouch to the clitoris and penis. 9. the region immediately superior to the perineal membrane is the _________ _________ ___________. 2.2 quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the perineal body is a point of attachment for muscles of the perineum. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the perineal body 16 the perineal body is a knot of ct that acts as an important point of attachment for muscles and connective tissue structures of both the pelvic floor (left) and the perineum (right). it is located in the midline between the posterior border of the perineal membrane and the opening for the anal canal. amongst other muscles, the levator ani attaches here, specifically the portion that forms the posterior border of urogenital hiatus. it also provides attachment for muscles of the perineum in both the deep and superficial pouches. 10. the _________ ___________ is a knot of connective tissue located between the urogenital hiatus and the opening for the anal canal. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the ischioanal fossae are bordered by the pelvic diaphragm, medially, and the obturator internis, laterally. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the ischioanal fossae previous 17 in the accompanying graphic, the funnel again represents the pelvic diaphragm. the cylinder that it rests in represents the bony pelvis. the inferior opening of the cylinder represents the pelvic outlet. the mouth of the funnel represents the line of attachment of the pelvic diaphragm to the wall of the pelvis. the space within and above the funnel represents the pelvic cavity. notice the space outside the funnel, but inside the cylinder. this represents a part of the perineum called the the ischioanal fossae. the ischioanal fossae are fat-filled spaces that permit the expansion of the anal canal during defecation. it also contains important nerves, including those to the external anal and the external urethral sphincters. the pelvic diaphragm consists of the levator ani and the coccygeus muscles, seen here: . notice, in this illustration, that the coccygeus extends from the sacrum to the ischial spine, forming the posterior portions of the pelvic diaphragm. the remainder of the pelvic diaphragm is made up of the levator ani muscle. look closely at the line of attachment of the levator ani, via a tendinous arch, across the internal surface of the obturator internis muscle. the line of attachment of the levator ani, via this tendinous arch, bisects the obturator internis muscle such that the superior half of the obturator internis is in the true pelvis and the inferior half is in the perineum. this is very important to understand! 11. the perineal spaces lateral to the anal canal are the _________ ___________. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the deep perineal pouch is immediately inferior to the ischioanal fossae. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the anterior recesses of the ischioanal fossae 18 the ischioanal fossae of the anal triangle extend into the urogenital triangle superior to the deep perineal pouch and perineal membrane. these are the anterior recesses of the ischioanal fossae. look at figure c and confirm the following: the floors of the anterior recesses are the deep perineal pouch. the lateral walls of the anterior recesses are the obturator internis muscle. the medial walls of the anterior recesses are the levator ani. the anterior recesses of the ischioanal fossae are dead-end spaces that end at the pubis, to which both the perineal membrane and the levator ani attach. realize that the anterior recesses are extensions of the ischioanal fossae; these spaces are continuous with each other and filled with fat. they also, however contain important neurovascular elements that serve perineal structures. 12. the _________ ___________ ___________ forms the floor of the anterior recesses of the ischioanal fossae. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the perineal membrane is the roof of the superficial perineal pouch. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the superficial perineal pouch and corpora cavernosa 19 the portions of the ug triangle described thus far are the perineal membrane, deep perineal pouch and the anterior recesses of the ischioanal fossa. next is the region superficial to the perineal membrane. the region of the ug triangle between the membranous layer of superficial fascia and the perineal membrane is the superficial perineal pouch. this region contains the erectile structures of the external genitalia and associated skeletal muscles. in both sexes, bilaterally-paired erectile bodies, the corpora cavernosa , are fused to the ischiopubic rami, proximally. their distal, unfixed ends form the body of the clitoris in women, and contribute to the body of the penis in men. the proximal, attached ends of these erectile structures are called the crura of the clitoris or crura of the penis . singular: corpus cavernosum singular: crus 13. the superficial perineal pouch is limited superiorly by the ________ _________. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the vestibule is the space into which the urethra and vagina open. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the bulbs of the vestibule and the corpus spongiosum 20 in women, the space between the labia minora, into which the urethra and vagina open, is called the vestibule. a second pair of erectile bodies, thebulbs of the vestibule, surround this space bilaterally, fused to the inferior surface of the perineal membrane. tapered, anterior extensions of the bulbs of the vestibule meet in the midline, anterior to the urethral opening, as the glans clitoris. the male homologue of the bulbs of the vestibule is the corpus spongiosum, a single midline erectile body. its proximal end is enlarged as the bulb of the penis, and is fused to the inferior surface of the perineal membrane. its distal end joins the corpora cavernosa to complete the body of the penis, and expands to cover their distal ends as the glans penis. the male urethra extend through the corpus spongiosum to open at the tip of the glans penis at the external urethral orifice. by convention, in anatomical position, the penis is erect. therefore, the corpus spongiosum is described as being ventral to the corpora cavernosa, although their relationships are the opposite in the flaccid penis. 14. the space between the labia minora is called the _____________. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the bulbs of the vestibule are separate structures in the female that are fused to form the bulb of the penis in the male. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the bulbs of the vestibule and the corpus spongiosum 20 in women, the space between the labia minora, into which the urethra and vagina open, is called the vestibule. a second pair of erectile bodies, thebulbs of the vestibule, surround this space bilaterally, fused to the inferior surface of the perineal membrane. tapered, anterior extensions of the bulbs of the vestibule meet in the midline, anterior to the urethral opening, as the glans clitoris. the male homologue of the bulbs of the vestibule is the corpus spongiosum, a single midline erectile body. its proximal end is enlarged as the bulb of the penis, and is fused to the inferior surface of the perineal membrane. its distal end joins the corpora cavernosa to complete the body of the penis, and expands to cover their distal ends as the glans penis. the male urethra extend through the corpus spongiosum to open at the tip of the glans penis at the external urethral orifice. by convention, in anatomical position, the penis is erect. therefore, the corpus spongiosum is described as being ventral to the corpora cavernosa, although their relationships are the opposite in the flaccid penis. 15. the female homologue of the corpus spongiosum are the _____________ of the ______________. (two words, separated by one space) 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the greater vestibular glands secrete mucus into the vagina in response to sexual arousal. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a greater vestibular glands and bulbourethral glands 21 in women, the greater vestibular glands are located in the superficial perineal pouch. these pea-sized, mucus-secreting glands are located posterior to the bulbs of the vestibule. the ducts of the greater vestibular glands open into the vestibule and secrete mucus in response to sexual arousal. the male homologue of the greater vestibular glands are the bulbourethral glands. like the greater vestibular glands, the bulbourethral glands secrete mucus in response to sexual arousal. they are, however, located in the deep perineal pouch in contrast to the greater vestibular glands, which are located in the superficial perineal pouch. their ducts open into the urethra as it passes through the perineal membrane. eponym: bartholins glands 16. the female homologue of the bulbourethral glands are the _____________ ______________ glands. 22a quiz submit

22a skeletal muscle of the perineum 22 the ischiocavernosus muscles overly the crura of the clitoris and penis. on contraction, they propel blood from the crura to the body of the clitoris or penis. the bulbospongiosus muscles extend from the perineal body to overlie the bulb(s) of the vestibule and penis. in females, the bulbospongiosus are two separate muscles. in males, however, the two bulbospongiosus muscles are fused in a midline raphe to cover over the bulb of the penis. in both sexes, the bulbospongiosus contracts to propel blood from the engorged bulb into more distal parts, including the glans. in men, the bulbospongiosus also: i) assists with emptying the penile urethra following micturition, and ii) contracts reflexively during ejaculation, causing the pulsatile expulsion of semen from the penis. three paired skeletal muscles occupy the superficial perineal pouch. two will be described. incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the external urethral sphincter is located in the deep perineal pouch and the external anal sphincter is located in the anal triangle. continue continue continue continue continue continue 17. which are skeletal muscle of the superficial perineal pouch? choose all that apply. bulbospongiosus bulbospongiosus bulbospongiosus bulbospongiosus bulbospongiosus bulbospongiosus ischiocavernosus ischiocavernosus ischiocavernosus ischiocavernosus ischiocavernosus ischiocavernosus external urethral sphincter external urethral sphincter external urethral sphincter external urethral sphincter external urethral sphincter external urethral sphincter external anal sphincter external anal sphincter external anal sphincter external anal sphincter external anal sphincter external anal sphincter submit

22a the pudendal nerve and the pelvic splanchnic nerve 24 because the pudendal nerves arise from the same spinal levels as the pelvic splanchnic nerves, students confuse them . a somatic nerve like, for example, the median nerve of the arm, intercostal nerves, and the femoral nerve of the leg the pelvic splanchnic nerves contain parasympathetic preganglionic fibres, the cell bodies of which are located in the intermediolateral cell column of the sacral spinal cord at the s2-s4 levels. the pelvic splanchnic nerves form on the posterior wall of the sacrum and feed into the inferior hypogastric plexus, from which their axons are distributed to the viscera of the distal digestive tract and pelvis. from the prostatic plexus, axons pass through the urogenital hiatus with the urethra to access the vascular smooth muscle of the erectile tissues of the penis and clitoris. these parasympathetic nerves are responsible for erection. the pudendal nerve is a somatic nerve . it contains the axons of lower motor neurons, the cell bodies of which are located in the ventral horns of the spinal cord at the s2-s4 levels. these axons are destined to innervate skeletal muscle of the perineum. it contains sensory fibres being distributed to the skin of the perineum and sympathetic postganglionic fibres that innervate vascular smooth muscle, as well as glands and erector pili muscle of the skin of the perineum. dont be that student! read on! incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the pudendal nerve contains the same fibre types as any other nerve that innervates the body wall or limbs. continue continue continue continue continue continue 18. what fibre types are present in the pudendal nerve? choose all that apply. somatic motor somatic motor somatic motor somatic motor somatic motor somatic motor general sensory general sensory general sensory general sensory general sensory general sensory sympathetic sympathetic sympathetic sympathetic sympathetic sympathetic parasympathetic parasympathetic parasympathetic parasympathetic parasympathetic parasympathetic submit

22a autonomic nerves of the perineum 26 pelvic portions of the prevertebral plexus provide sympathetic, parasympathetic and visceral afferent fibres to pelvic structures and to the erectile tissues of the perineum. the pelvic portions of the prevertebral plexus are bilaterally paired and are referred to, variably, as the pelvic plexuses or the inferior hypogastric plexuses. the inferior hypogastric plexuses receive sympathetic fibres from the sacral splanchnic nerves, and parasympathetic fibres from the pelvic splanchnic nerves. the inferior hypogastric plexuses give rise to the rectal, uterovaginal, prostatic and vesical plexuses. the erectile tissues of the perineum are innervated by terminal branches of the inferior hypogastric plexuses that pass through the deep perineal pouch. in men, these are the cavernous nerves, derived from the prostatic plexus. in women these nerves are likely derived from the uterovaginal plexus. because of the close association of the cavernous nerves with the prostate, impotence can be a complication of prostatectomy. similarly, sexual dysfunction can be a complication in hysterectomy. incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the cavernous nerves are derived from the prostatic plexus. they pass through the perineal membrane with the urethra to supply the erectile tissue of the perineum. continue continue continue continue continue continue 19. which of the following nerves carry parasympathetic fibres responsible for erection? pudendal nerves pudendal nerves pudendal nerves pudendal nerves pudendal nerves pudendal nerves dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves submit

22a somatic nerves of the perineum 25 the pudendal nerve has three major branches: the inferior rectal nerve crosses the ischioanal fossa to innervate the external anal sphincter and portions of the levator ani and the skin of the anal triangle. the perineal nerve enters the superficial perineal pouch to innervate its skeletal muscle, the skin of the urogenital triangle and ends as the cutaneous posterior scrotal / labial nerves. the third branch traverses the deep perineal pouch to end as the dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris. incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! these nerves supply the skin and skeletal muscle of the perineum. continue continue continue continue continue continue 20. which of the following are branches of the pudendal nerves? choose all that apply. inferior rectal nerves inferior rectal nerves inferior rectal nerves inferior rectal nerves inferior rectal nerves inferior rectal nerves dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris dorsal nerve of the penis / clitoris cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves cavernous nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves perineal nerves submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the internal urethral sphincter is derived from circularly-arranged smooth muscle at the neck of the urinary bladder. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the urinary system in the pelvis 30 in both sexes, the pelvic portions of the urinary system are the terminal parts of the ureters, the urinary bladder and the proximal portions of the urethra. the ureters enters the pelvic inlet by crossing anterior to the bifurcation of the common iliac artery. the ureters continue along the posterior wall of the pelvis to pierce the base of the urinary bladder. the urinary bladder is located immediately posterior to the pubic symphysis. the bladder, when empty, is located in the true pelvis. when full, however, it expands into the abdomen. recall that the urinary bladder is a triangular pyramid , with its base oriented posteriorly, its apex oriented anteriorly, a superior surface and two inferolateral surfaces. the neck of the bladder surrounds the origin of the urethra, and contains the internal urethral sphincter, composed of smooth, involuntary muscle. 21. the ________ ________ sphincter is located at the neck of the urinary bladder. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the paraurethral glands secrete mucus into the terminal urethra of the female. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the female urethra 31 in the female, the urethra extends from the internal urethral orifice at the neck of the bladder, through the pelvic floor, to open into the vestibule at the external urethral orifice. as the urethra passes through the pelvic floor it is surrounded by the striated, voluntary external urethral sphincter, located in the deep perineal pouch. the labia minora form the borders of the vestibule, the space into which the urethra and vagina open. the female urethra is 4 cm long, significantly shorter than the male urethra. the urethra lies anterior to the vagina and the two are joined by ct. the para-urethral (skenes) glands are paired mucus-secreting glands that open into the terminal urethra. 22. the ___________ glands are associated with the terminus of the female urethra. 22a quiz submit

22a the ovaries and fallopian tubes 34 in the female embryo, the gubernaculum connects the female gonad to the labium majus, the female homologue of the scrotum. the remnants of the gubernaculum in the female are the ligament of the ovary and the round ligament, the latter passing through the inguinal canal to the labium majus. the uterine tubes extend laterally from the superolateral aspect of the uterus. the uterine tubes are end as the expanded infundibulum of the uterine tube with its fimbriae. the uterine tube opens into the peritoneal cavity, and eggs released by the ovary must be drawn into the lumen of the uterine tube. the most common site of fertilization is in the ampulla of the uterine tube; the conceptus then passing along its isthmus and intramural portion to access the uterine cavity. in the embryo, the ovaries originate high up in the posterior abdominal wall, and that they migrate, prenatally, to their ultimate position in the pelvis. this is analogous to the descent of the testes in the male, although the ovaries do not migrate into the perineum. ovarian nerves, vessels and lymphatics are located in the suspensory ligament of the ovary, and travel back, through the posterior abdominal wall, to the embryonic level of origin of the ovaries. incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! these structures extend from the gonad (ovary) to the tissues of the labium majus. continue continue continue continue continue continue 23. which of the following are remnants of the gubernaculum? choose all that apply. the ligament of the ovary the ligament of the ovary the ligament of the ovary the ligament of the ovary the ligament of the ovary the ligament of the ovary the round ligament the round ligament the round ligament the round ligament the round ligament the round ligament the suspensory ligament the suspensory ligament the suspensory ligament the suspensory ligament the suspensory ligament the suspensory ligament the broad ligament the broad ligament the broad ligament the broad ligament the broad ligament the broad ligament submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the vaginal fornix surrounds the cervix. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the cervix and vagina 35 the body of the uterus is anteflexed relative to the cervix, and comes to lie superior to the bladder. the cervix itself is anteverted relative to the vagina. the thick wall of the cervix bulges into the proximal end of the thin-walled vaginal canal. the recess where the cervix is continuous with the wall of the vagina is the vaginal fornix. the uterine cavity is continuous with the cervical canal at the internal os and the cervical canal is continuous with the vaginal canal at the external os. the anterior wall of the vagina lies adjacent to the base of the bladder and urethra . the vagina and urethra pass from the pelvis, through the pelvic floor to the perineum, where both structures open into the vestibule. the posterior wall of the vagina lies adjacent to the rectum, separated by the rectovaginal septum. the junction between the thick-walled cervix and thin-walled vagina creates a ring-like recess around the margin of the cervix called the vaginal fornix. because the vaginal canal is normally collapsed, a physician uses a speculum to open the vagina in order to view the cervix, fornix and external os (see lower figure). anteflexed arched or bent forward; the uterus is bent forward at the junction of its body and cervix anteverted a position that is pivoted, or tilted, forward relative to the position of another structure; the cervix of the uterus tilts forward relative to the vagina. os mouth 24. the _______ is a recess that surrounds the cervix at its junction with the vagina. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the inferior hypogastric plexus is located anterior to the sacrum and gives rise to these visceral plexuses. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a autonomic nerves of the pelvis 37 pelvic portions of the prevertebral plexus provide sympathetic, parasympathetic and visceral afferent fibres to pelvic structures and to the erectile tissues of the perineum. the pelvic portions of the prevertebral plexus are bilaterally paired and are referred to, variably, as the pelvic plexuses or the inferior hypogastric plexuses. the inferior hypogastric plexuses receive sympathetic fibres from the sacral splanchnic nerves, and parasympathetic fibres from the pelvic splanchnic nerves. the inferior hypogastric plexuses give rise to the rectal, uterovaginal, prostatic and vesical plexuses. sympathetic fibres in these plexuses are responsible for vascular tone, contraction of smooth muscle sphincters of the anus and urethra, contraction of smooth muscle in the walls of the reproductive tracts and their accessory glands, including during emission in males. parasympathetic fibres in these plexuses are responsible for contraction of the detrusor muscle of the bladder, motility of the distal digestive tract, and relaxation of smooth muscle in erectile tissues, which results in engorgement and erection. 25. the the rectal, uterovaginal, prostatic and vesical plexuses are derived from the _____________ _____________ plexus. 22a quiz submit

the female anterior trunk incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the anterior trunk of the internal iliac artery gives rise to the arteries that supply these viscera. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a the anterior trunk of the internal iliac artery 39 in males, each anterior trunk gives rise to a(n): superior and inferior vesical arteries, supplying the bladder, ureter, seminal vesicles and prostate gland. inferior gluteal artery, which contributes to the blood supply of the gluteal region. middle rectal artery, supplying the rectum, along with the superior rectal artery from the inferior mesenteric artery and the inferior rectal arteries from the internal pudendal arteries. obturator artery, which enters the medial compartment of the thigh via the obturator canal. internal pudendal artery, which exits the pelvis via the greater sciatic foramen and enters the perineum via the lesser sciatic foramen to supply perineal structures. in females: in place of an inferior vesicle artery, women have a vaginal artery, which supplies the vagina and adjacent parts of the bladder, urethra and rectum. the uterine artery is a major branch that runs in the base of the broad ligament to the cervix, where it anastomoses with the vaginal artery. there the vaginal artery turns to ascend along the lateral aspect of the uterus, and runs along the uterine tubes, where it ends in an anastomosis with the ovarian artery. the male anterior trunk 26. arteries to the urinary bladder, uterus and vagina are derived from the _____________ trunk of the _____________ _____________ artery. (three words, each separated by one space) 22a quiz submit

lymphatic drainage of the pelvis incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the lymph nodes associated with the internal iliac arteries receive lymph from pelvic and deep perineal structures. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a venous and lymphatic drainage of the pelvis 40 in general, pelvic veins follow their companion arteries and take the same names. pelvic veins drain into the internal iliac vein, which ascends over the pelvic brim and joins the external iliac vein to form the common iliac vein. interconnecting networks of venous plexuses surround the pelvic viscera, forming the vesical, rectal, uterine, vaginal and prostatic venous plexuses. a tributary of the prostatic plexus in males, and of the vesical plexus in females, is the deep dorsal vein of the penis / clitoris. it drains venous blood from these erectile tissues directly into the pelvis by passing between the posterior margin of the pubic symphysis and the anterior margin of the perineal membrane. lymph nodes associated with the internal iliac arteries receive lymph from pelvic and deep perineal structures. lymph nodes associated with the external iliac arteries receive lymph from the superficial and deep inguinal nodes. lymph nodes associated with the common iliac arteries receive lymph from both these groups of nodes, and convey it superiorly into the lateral aortic / lumbar nodes. these drain into the lumbar trunks, which empty into the cisterna chyle. it continues superiorly as the thoracic duct. venous drainage of the pelvis 27. lymph from pelvic and deep perineal structures drain toward lymph nodes associated with the _____________ _____________ arteries. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! a is the obturator foramen. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a ap pelvic x-ray anterior superior iliac spine acetabulum obturator foramen pelvic inlet (infra)pubic angle the pelvis on the right is male, and the pelvis on the left is female. describe 3 differences between the male and female pelvis that are demonstrated in these images. wider, more circular, pelvic inlet larger (infra)pubic angle greater distance between asiss 28. identify a. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! a is the pelvic inlet, bordered by the pelvic brim. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a ap pelvic x-ray anterior superior iliac spine acetabulum obturator foramen pelvic inlet (infra)pubic angle the pelvis on the right is male, and the pelvis on the left is female. describe 3 differences between the male and female pelvis that are demonstrated in these images. wider, more circular, pelvic inlet larger (infra)pubic angle greater distance between asiss 29. identify a. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the common iliac artery arises from the bifurcation of the abdominal aorta. continue continue continue continue continue continue 22a pelvic arteriogram, ap view previous in this normal pelvic arteriogram, identify arteries a through e. 42 abdominal aorta common iliac artery lumbar artery external iliac artery internal iliac artery 30. identify a. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! b are the pubic bones. continue continue continue continue continue continue previous 22a female perineum, axial mri i 47 ischial tuberosities pubic bones pubic symphysis obturator foramina obturator internis urethra vagina rectum levator ani (puborectalis subdivision) fat in ischioanal fossae gluteus maximus 31. identify b. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the ischioanal fossae are filled with fat in life. continue continue continue continue continue continue previous a. ischial tuberosities b. ischiopubic / conjoint rami d. anal canal g. crura of clitoris j. fat in ischioanal fossae k. gluteus maximus l. perineal membrane m. vestibule n. labia majora o. mons pubis 22a female perineum, axial mri ii 49 32. identify j. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the prostate gland is located inferior to the bladder and surrounds its neck. continue continue continue continue continue continue previous 22a male pelvis, axial mri 51 a. sacrum b. coccyx c. pubic symphysis d. urinary bladder e. prostate gland i. external urethral sphincter j. internal urethral sphincter k. bulb of the penis l. corpus spongiosus m. corpus cavernosus n. rectum o. anal canal r. rectovesical fossa 33. identify e. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the cervix is located at the junction of the uterus with the vagina. continue continue continue continue continue continue previous 22a female pelvis, axial mri 53 a. sacrum b. coccyx c. pubic symphysis d. urinary bladder i. body of uterus j. fundus of uterus k. cervix of uterus l. vagina o. rectum q. rectouterine pouch 34. identify k. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the internal urethral sphincter is located at the neck of the bladder. continue continue continue continue continue continue previous 22a male pelvis, coronal mri 54 femoral heads ilium cavity of hip joints obturator internis urinary bladder internal urethral sphincter prostate gland levator ani external urethral sphincter bulb of penis / corpus spongiosum 35. name the muscle at f. 22a quiz submit

incorrect try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. click here to learn the answer, then come back to try again. correct thats right! the follicular fluid gives a high signal. continue continue continue continue continue continue previous 22a female pelvis, coronal mri i 55 femoral heads ilium obturator internis urinary bladder urethra internal urethral sphincter external urethral sphincter fundus of uterus uterine tube / broad ligament ovary ovarian follicle sigmoid colon 36. identify k. be specific. (hint: fluid is white) 22a quiz submit
